reviews.review_text: This is great!! I like that they're unlocked too because my dad refuses to enter the smart phone world.. he had the same phone for over ten years and then it broke ATT actually recommended this and type him to get it and come back they see it all up for him .. glad Walmart still carries these for my Dad ü•∞

reviews.title: Decent
reviews.review_text: i bought this phone%26 shipped it to my son in another State. its locked to AT%26T which is his carrier. When he took SIM out of old phone n put in new phone, it automatically cancelled out his AT%26T account. He had to go to AT%26T, they said Walmart sold it wrong (shrugs) %26 it happens a lot but they couldn't fix. he had to go to Walmart %26 tell them about it. They took phone back as a return, then gave him a gift card to repurchase it %26 whatever wasnt done b4 i bought it, they did %26 then he got his number back %26 it worked. He said it showed up like it was stolen? anyways....a mess 4 him but its finally working

My mother is older and only wants a flip phone. Walmart had exactly the phone she wanted and we were able to get it activated by our provider (AT%26T) for a relatively simple swap from her old flip phone. She's very happy with this new one. Easy to use. Simple.
While I know some don't want the older phones, the individual I purchased this for needs the simplicity of the older phone.

reviews.title: üåû
reviews.review_text: It's cute %26 light, It's a basic phone. If you don't have an AT%26T account, You can't unlock the device until 6mth from purchase. They should also offer a $15 plan like Boost Mobile. I just need something for emergencies that wont die so quickly like iPhone. Plus I'm looking to reduce social media and this is definitely a great device for that. It would be nice if It had some app, meditation, mental health or even banking.
Just purchased like about a month to two months ago and I can't seem to turn the phone on after charging. Even left it charging for 3 days it still won't turn on.
I needed a phone quick, andd it was delivered to my apartment 5 hours later. It is not a high dollar phone by any means, but it works. Its a flip phone and fits in my pocket nicely.

The phone will not turn on. When I plug it in, something on the inside screen flashes on and off saying ‚Äúenabled by KaiOS‚Äù while vibrating but nothing else happens. The button labeled the power button does not turn it on and even after leaving in charger for 4 hours, still the same thing. There are no clear instructions for how to turn the device on either.

reviews.title: Not reg. service phone
reviews.review_text: I realize this is a prepaid phone. But I bought it to use for the phone only on my regular acct. Now neither of my phones will work. At first it did now it says there was a problem with activation. The acct is not in my name so I can t call to fix it, the acct holder will have to. It has made a terrible mess for me. I do like the size of the buttons and screen.

NEVER order online to be shipped to you. They will not show lt as being paid for and claim it can be set up at another Walmart ,which is not as the girls act like they don't have any idea what you're speaking about. I prefer the standard flip phone over all others, but trying to get one is like pulling hens teeth

reviews.title: Stopped Charging
reviews.review_text: Wet cheaply made. Purchased for grandfather for ease of use it advertised and described to be. However it was not, the battery life was ok first couple of weeks now phone won't charge and doesn't work.

The price was really good compared to other places. However, I originally went into the store and the employees in that department were not helpful. One handed the keys off to someone else and the next one fiddled with the case for a few minutes and then gave up and said he couldn't open it. He didn't try to get a manager or anything.

reviews.title: Couldn't get battery in phone. Very unhappy.
reviews.review_text: Needed an immediate phone while got a better replacement phone. Good price. However, The battery was separate from the phone and it wasn't obvious to me how to insert the battery. (No paperwork about the battery: i figured I would break the phone trying to figure out how to insert it. ) Someone wanted to save a couple of pennies by omitting the instructions.

reviews.title: Basic phone, but good
reviews.review_text: I bought this phone for my elderly father. It's just like his previous one, so he already knew how to use it. I don't think it would be difficult to use anyway. The price can't be beat. His other phone was quadruple the price of this one. I took it to the AT%26T store, where they transferred the old SIM card to his new phone. So far, so good.

great little easy to use flip phone....BUT, it is LOCKED and I want to use a compatible cartier, which I have always done with my previous Cingular flip phone. Cannot figure out how to unlock. if u want to use At %26 T, it really is great phone for kids or seniors.

reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY- can't activate phone
reviews.review_text: Purchased from Walmart.com %26 can't activate the phone to use it. I have added $30 plan to it and can't use the phone, can't return it nor get the minutes back. MAJOR LOSS. The representative claims the phone was not scanned properly as purchased, cant even activate in store nor return this is SAD! Waste of money

reviews.title: Can't activate
reviews.review_text: I have spent hours at AT%26T trying to activate this phone. They finally realized that when you purchased the item through online Walmart stores, they often find that they are coded as a blacklisted item. Not necessarily stolen but classified as that. I am now having to return it to my local Walmart. They said the items sold at the store do not seem to have the same problem, but for some reason online Walmart they have seen this on several occasions became a very frustrating hassle.

reviews.title: A great phone for people who hate phones
reviews.review_text: You can use this phone to make phone calls. T9 texting is tedious but functional so not recommended. It has hotspot functionality so you can connect a real computer to use the internet. It's made of solid plastic with Chinese craftsmanship. If you drop it in the toilet, who cares? It's only $30. Buy two. Smartphones are for teenagers. This is a real phone for grownups.

Im hoping it was just this phone that thevolume was broke. it has a loud ringer but not many choices. I returned this one because even with the talking volume was at 15 the only way to hear it was to turn on the speaker. Walmart gave me a refund no problem.
It's a nice size and great for people who want a flip phone. The one problem is it shutting down all the time.

reviews.title: doesn't activate
reviews.review_text: att said to return to the retailer i bought it from because they couldnt complete activation. once they fix it i will chahge my rating.
These phones are okay and only last about 2 years before needing replacement and batteries cost more than new phone
I purchased for my elderly mother. Wprked great for her until she lost it. So I'm purchasing another one lol!

After setting up phone and putting minutes on it. Two days later we could not call out or take any calls. Called 611 and it said, ‚Äúwe need to go to retail and let them register the phone. Still not working. Set up return and will be taking it back.

reviews.title: not working

reviews.title: Best product you have a lot of people b theproduct
reviews.review_text: Good phone when you're in need of a good phone on the road or for whatever reason you're in need of a new phone and don't have the money to buy a expensive phone get this phone great product for the price

reviews.title: Great phone at a nominal cost.
reviews.review_text: I was so excited to be able to purchase this flip phone for a nominal cost compared to other models. It works just as well as the others and it was half the cost of others that I have purchased before.

reviews.title: ok flip phone
reviews.review_text: not a bad flip phone but not as decent as the first generation phones like this one, this one does not have a fingerprint reader, pretty much it works the same as the first generation but the one thing I didn't like is it didn't have the some of the same apps as the first generation, I literally can search for an app on the first generation phone but not find it on the second generation Phone App Store. for a flip phone the price is right though, I'm returning it since since one of the main apps I need it does not let me download

reviews.title: Major hassle so far.

When my sister took it to Walmart, they said ‚ÄúTake it to AT%26T.‚Äù It would be nice, since we bought it from Walmart, if Walmart could actually either activate it, or advise us what to do.

reviews.title: Flip Phone Relief
reviews.review_text: When I originally signed up with AT%26T I was told they did not carry flip phones anymore. We tried what I thought was a simple smart phone for my 83 yo father. It was not. Thankfully I found out you could buy a flip phone and change out the SIM card while keeping it in your current number and plan. I'm not sure why the AT%26T rep left out that tidbit other than I'm still paying for the smart phone and it's useless. They should do a better job for elderly because this flip phone works great. The buttons are bigger and you only have to open it to answer.

reviews.title: Great phone
reviews.review_text: Bought the phone for my 95 yr old dad since he was used to a small flip phone. Was able to have his AT%26T service connected without any problems.
The price was half of what it would have cost at the ATT store and similar to the previous phone I had so nothing new to learn.

It worked fine for a while, but very hard to turn on. Tuesday morning,1/16 at 7;30 checked the weather due to freezing temps Later that morning i plugged in the charger and the phone went complete dead?? Will not turn on, or charge. Lucky that the electricity stayed on, or I would have been stranded. Am returning it..

reviews.title: awesome purchase for flip phone lovers
reviews.review_text: The phone works great. I get great service. The sound quality is really good for a phone this cheap. Loud especially on speaker phone. The only thing that sucks about this phone is the camera but that's expected. Overall Its a great purchase for anyone that enjoys the original flip phone experience.

reviews.title: Prepaid phone a no-go

reviews.title: Not as advertised; specs are wrong!
reviews.review_text: 1. The phone comes with 2GB, not 4GB. 2. The rear camera is only 2MP, there is no 32MP rear camera, there is no LED flash, and there is no front-facing camera. 3. It runs KaiOS 3.1, not Android 13. 4. It does not have a fingerprint reader. 5. The battery is only 1450mAh, not 4000mAh. It's still a decent phone for the price and it has nice big buttons and a bright screen. It also has a mobile Wi-Fi hotspot feature (you need to have the service enabled on your plan). I wish it took as good of pictures as the original Cingular Flex which has an LED flash. I'm not going to return it but i wish they would fix the listing because this is technically false advertising.
